main event: A silver-shaped object was observed above 10,000 ft for one hour on March 15, 1956.
interesting points: The object was the size of a silver dollar and was moving towards the edge of elevation before disappearing., According to instrument readings, it was at an altitude above 13,222 ft., A local pilot and photographer attempted to get closer to the object but could not capture any photographs., The observation lasted for one hour and included ground visual and binoculars., The conclusion suggested it might be a possible astronomical phenomenon.
